text: Bottle shared at muckfest. The beer is a hazy yellow with a white head of foam. The aroma has juicy citrus and sweet tart notes. Tart and citric. Light body and medium carbonation.
Bottle - Funky fart notes and melon. Cloudy gold with a small white head. Apple and some stone fruit with a touch of tart dry vinegar.
Pours a hazy pale peach colour with no head. Aroma of grapefruit pithe and general tartness. Light bodied, with a dry acidic taste thats a hint grainy. A very tasty berliner.
750 ml bottle. Pours a dirty yellow with light head. Aromas of wet sulphury wheat and salt. Flavors wheat, grapes, sweet citrus and salt. Sharp - refreshing.

Cloudy and quite pale. Smells like stinging lactic and a bit of yeasty-funky character. Its very tart, bit wheaty. Cleaner on the palate than it was on the nose. Pretty true to style, if a bit sharp for everyday drinking.

750ml bottle @ Matts. Pours a pale straw colour with no head. Nose is lemon with a hint lacto. Flavour is tart with an citric acidity that is almost astringent character. It is light bodied and it is sour but it doesnt have much depth or character to keep me interested.
750ml bottle (thx, Kump!) at Matts. Pours a hazy blonde with no head. Aroma is funky, yeasty and sour. Same taste with moderate sourness. Refreshing, not bad.

750mL bottle, pours a hazy blonde with a small white head. Aroma is fairly tart, with citrus and tropical fruits, followed by light lacto. Flavour is very tart, with lots of citric, pithy tartness, some tropical fruits, some stone fruitiness and moderate lacto. Lactic, acidic and pithy on the finish. Not very impressed with this.

Bottle opened up at the 2016 Ottawa Year-end Gathering. Clear golden pour with a thin off white head that mostly disappears. Some lemon, epson salts, light sulphur, brett, some cantaloupe rind, mild tartness, straw. Moderate carbonation and mild body, easy to drink and refreshing.
Very drinkable berliner. With some wheat for balance. Not too tart but it is tart. Very drinkable, approachable.
Hazy yellow pour, minimal head. Straw, yeast, light citrus aroma. Easily approachable, lightly sour, salty, wheat, straw. Light body, understated carbonation.

Bottle: Poured a pale beige color ale with a medium foamy head with OK retention. Aroma of tart and fruity notes. Taste is mix of tart notes with some slightly weird flavours and some vinegary notes. Body is about average with good carbonation. Slightly off-balance and a bit too vinegary for my taste but still enjoyable overall.

Bottle at Xmas 2016 gathering, thanks Stephen! Pours light straw, cloudy limited head and lacing. Notes of tart lemon, maybe some peach and pear. Taste is medium tart, light sweet. Light body with lively carbonation.

A hazed yellow Weisse with a thin white head. In aroma, nice tart lemon malt with light mineral notes, Epsom salts, light Brett, pleasant. In mouth, a nice sweet fruity malt with light lemon notes, lactic acid, Epsom salts, very nice and smooth. Bottle at Ottawa Xmas gathering 2016.
Bottle from 15 in August, 16. Very light straw color. Nose is light peach, some sour wheat, light lemon. Flavors follow, with nice stone fruit characteristics. Lightly tart, very balanced.

750mL shared at Woodshop 10. Low haze straw pour. Beautiful peaches and cream aroma, some white peach. Taste is light-bodied, white peach comes through, lemon acid is not over the top. Clean profile for this style with little funkiness. Some sweet white grape for balance. Very nice.

On tap at the Trappist. Been waiting a while to get the chance to try this and I wasnt disappointed. It pours a super pale yellow color with a nice, lasting white head. The aroma is very pleasant with lemon, apricots, light orchard fruit and wheaty funk. The flavor is almost perfect. Great apricot and lemon tartness. Super refreshing with soft, fresh hewn wheat. It has a lightly fluffy mouthfeel despite the low gravity. Fine bubbled carbonation. A real masterpiece.

Bottle. Pours cloudy pale yellow with a faint orange glow. Fizzy head fades within seconds. Aroma is incredibly fruity and nuanced, with grapefruit juice, tamarind, orange peel, lemon juice, lime, grain, minerals, light spice. Taste is lemon and grain of course but with tons of juicy grapefruit, faint red berries, lime zest, pineapple, and long sour grapefruit/lemon finish. Some oaky tannins. Fascinating beer that I liked much more than expected, with fruity nuances that most Berliners lack, and which places it almost more in the saison/sour saison category for me. Great stuff.
750ml. Very light straw color. Aroma is lemon heads. Slight lemon, straw, earthy. Tart and refreshing. Very good easy to drink Berliner. This would be a great summer session beer.
Bottle shared at homers pad. Aroma is super tart and sour. Pour is hazy pale yellow. Taste is the same, tart and sour. Too much taryness, but still drinkable.
Bottle shared by bytemesis. Nose is immediately tart. With a bit of lemon. Slightly hazy pale yellow. Taste is immediately tart and sour. Really tart for a Berliner. I think this is batch 2 per Mike.
Bottle, homer tasting. Pours clear golden, small white head, minimal lacing. Aroma is funky, Sara culture, lemon, barnyard. Flavor is full tart, light funky, lemon. Light body, light carbonation.
Bottle share thanks to bytemesis. Mostly clear pour, straw yellow color, no head. Tart, sweet, apple aroma, wheaty. Nice, smooth tartness, light wheaty flavor, nice Berliner.

Bottle, pour hazy golden with ultra fluffy white top. Awesome looking beer. Aromas are pineapple, grapefruits hops, lemon skins, and funky wheat. Flavor was most of the same with a lactic lemon-peach finish. Medium to higher carbonation. Further solidifying their reputation of quality at SARA.
Bottle. Light yellow pour with no head. Light citrus, fruit tones, wild and funky aromas. Tart citrus, some funky, other wild flavors.

Slightly hazy straw yellow in color... Aroma of light wheat, citrus, lemon zest... Flavor is light and crisp, lemon zest and wheat, effervescent, slight funk on finish... Slight tartness... Refreshing and enjoyable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours a cloudy yellow with no head. The aroma is strong lemon, tart wheat, earth. Thin mouthfeel with lemon zest, wheat, tart finish. Very good.

[ Bottle ][ ½ of 75cl ][ Tasting ][ Trade ][ Snifter ][ 9.26.14 ]Murky hay-yellow color, large-bubbled gravity white head dies ultra fast, tepid with no effervescence, still otherwise, cider-like stillness. Really husky nose, grainy with considerable lemon, acids prevalent but none stand out, too watery. Light-mod body, low effervescence but ultra-slick, front is tons of soft grain, lactic acid dominating. Middle is still soft, faint yogurt with crackery malt that continues into the finish, watery with a rough envelope glue patch. Very pleasant, a few off notes, the thin body is the weakest aspect, the profile very balanced and sessionable.  [ 9.26 Tasting Ranking ]01. Allagash Little Sal02. Russian River T2503. Hill Farmstead Flora (Blueberry)04. Evil Twin Biere Blanca 05. Crooked Stave Petite Sour (Blueberry)06. OEC Exilis07. Russian River Consecration08. Block 15 Turbulent Cassis 09. De Garde Blu Bu 10. Sante Adairius Maiden Fields 11. Blue Lobster Piscataquaweisse 12. Evil Twin Justin Blabaer 13. Sante Adairius Lucy Blue 14. Three Floyds Chevalier Bertrand du Guesclin 15. Side Project Blueberry Flanders 16. Night Shift Mainer Weisse 17. Evil Twin Nomader 18. De Garde Currant Gin Bu

Pour is a transparent pale yellow with a white head that dissipates immediately and then sits still. Nose is a bit sharp, loads of dustiness, moderate lacto, and a fair bit of lemon. Taste is a bit more lemony, lacto mid palate but gentle, slight bitterness in the finish. Still fairly dusty up front with notes of grains. Lighter body, a bit slick mid palate, strong carb.
Pours a hazy light yellow with small head. Subtle aromas of salt, sea spray, lemon, wheat, and yogurt. Clean palate with lemon cleaner, wheat, light cream, and limon salt. Simple and refreshing.

Yellow pour with a white head. The aroma has some tart wheat and light lemon notes. The flavor is more pronounced. I get some nice tart lemon and juicy orange notes. There is also some lightly funky yeast and earth notes in the flavor. Thin mouthfeel and medium carbonation.
Glad to be one of SHERM1016s friends on this tasting! Split a bomber with Sherm1016 and Ross....lip pucking tart...but with a distinct wheat flavor.....excellent.
Bottle..pour is yellow with a thin white head..Nose is soured wheat, musty, funk, tart...Taste is funk, soured, spice, pale, funk....
Man this one is good. Hazy straw colored pour, fluffy bright white head. Lemons, limes, just enough sourness, some yeast and wheat. Bright and really tasty.
Bottle. Clear light yellow pour with a white head. Sour citrus aromas. Lemon and citrus notes. Clean with a god body and mouthfeel..
Bottle. Hazy pale yellow/white color, with a white head. Tartness, lemon peel, wheat, dry crackers, and a little bit earthy. Nice, drinkable and tasty.
Big thanks to Matt. An excellent Berliner with excellent earthy rustic character. Ill pass on the fruit for this one.

UPDATED: APR 11, 2015 750ml bottle in a tulip. Pours hazy, light golden with a small, white head. Aroma of sourness, light malts and wheat, plus light and citrusy fruits. Flavor the same with a nice tartness. Average texture. A really good Berliner.  Edit: Batch 2. Still great.  Better than I remembered.  The light tartness and citrus notes blend very well.
Pours a slightly-hazed yellow. Nose has some lactic acidity but also a bit of sulfur. Light acidity and easy drinking. Bit of wheat. Very nice other than sulfury nose.
Pours a light hazy yellow, with no head. Aroma of funk, lemons and wheat. Taste is slightly tart, funky. Light yet full of flavor. Really nice, not over the tops
Really sharp bright lemony berliner. Wheat is evident and a lactic tartness on the backend is complimented by citrus zest and cracker maltyness.

750 ml bottle acquired via trade. Been looking forward to this one for awhile. Pours a bright hazy yellow straw hue. Sunshine cornfield hues are a bit hazy, bright and pale with some champagne like glow. A frothy bright white head dies to a negligible ring with skant lacing. Aromas present big pleasing lactic acidity, bigger citric lemon tartness, some white grape and grapefruit juice. Some citrus rind, yogurty lemon, grainy rustic straw and cereal elements. Crisp, sour and yogurty with some cleaner light body, really nice lactic life. Potent and enjoyable, white peach and gentle sour green grape, kiwi. Lovely. Initial is lighter end of the fold, a bit slick and sour overall. Lemon rind, sour peaches, white grape and kiwi. Some straw, bready malt and yogurt cultures as we move on. Nice lactic zip keeps pushing, sustained sourness. Really nice flavors as it dries out a bit, shows some bready and straw malt as we hit the backend. The fruit presence is fairlly diverse, yogurty and fruity without just a blast of harsh lactic pop. This really works well. Lots of fruit complexity, sourness, without being overwhelming. Lotta green grape tartness, white peach, lemon, kiwi fruit and pretty tasty. Its sour but not overblown, balanced in that regard. A bit slick as that yogurty feel sticks in the finish. Quite crushable, really a nice summery session worthy beer. Can just imagine drinking this out in the shade. Tasty stuff. Nose is solid, appearance a touch lacking, but overall the beer is just lovely in flavor, balance, and flow. Perhaps a touch undercarbonated but nice stuff.
750, just your perfect regular berliner. Tart and wheaty with a long lasting complexity
Straw color, cloudy. Smells like soured grain heaven: lemon citrus galore. Taste rocks my world with more of the same. So clean, so crushable. WANT!

Hazy very pale blond. Fizzy carb. 
Nose is grazzy with lemon peel and wheat heavy.
very kiwi heavy with a touch of lemon peel. backbone lacks any malt character. peach, wheat. effervescent and thin. Akin more to a home-brew but would rock on a hot summer day

Thanks Jake 

Delicious berliner, nice tartness with a balance of tropical fruit and wheat. Lightly carbed, nice mouthfeel and crushable

Bottle... Berliner Bash on the Bay 2013... Lightly hazy golden pour with no head. The nose is acidic with a suggestion of apricot and a rumor of sulfur. Light to medium-bodied with prickly carbonation. The flavor is moderately puckering and lemony with a light, yeasty element. Finishes crisp and tart. Bottle courtesy of 50belair!

Bottle shared with Alan and Dennis. Pours yellow gold with no head. Nose and taste of sour wheat, lemon, lemon cake, light cheese, tangy citrus and sourness. Well balanced acidity. Soft carbonation. Lighter bodied.

pours hazy pale yellow with a very small white cap, little retention. cheese, oranges, bretts - moderate but present funk, woodsy, wheaty, citric and lactic - slightly puckering. low carbonation - small bubbles here and there, light body - oily, clean herbal and lactic finish. very nice!

Bottle. Hazy gold, a little darker than Flower Child. Peachy aroma, quite lemony, funky, pretty intense funk for the style, not just lactic but almost lambic like. Tart, lactic flavor, quite dry, very acidic. Palate is very dry, nice clean finish. Delicious.

Pours a nice golden with no head... Aroma is fruity and sour, sour peaches or something similar. Taste is sharply lactic, almost to an abrasive level of acidity. Fruits in the flavor reflect those on the nose. Light and refreshing. The "over the top" acidity make it a bit hard to drink, though. Still a nice first contact with Sante Adairius!

Bottle (750 ml). From Adam, thanks! Clear bright yellow/golden, no head and no lacing. Aroma is peachy with cheesy notes, tartness, oak, wheat and barnyard-like notes. Taste is tart and cheesy with peaches, oak, wheat acidity and a somewhat herbal finish. Body is kind of light, but not as much as you expect from a 4% abv Berliner. Low carbonation. Dry finish. Mouth puckering. Very good fruity/peachy Berliner Weisse.

Bottle 750ml.
Pours very pale blond with almost no head. Aroma is of fruits, cooked rabbit meat, white wine. Taste is of fruits, acidity, cooked rabbit meat, barnyard. Palate: Light body. Dry finish. Mouth puckering. Overall: Good, refreshing. A bit harsh, heavy on acid.

A - pours an amazingly light straw color, very very light with almost no head. S - really nice aromas of a barrel sour, lemon and light tart white grape? notes. Yeast and light wheat notes. Subtle funk and lager-like notes. Simple and clean. M - light bright and tart. Average carb. Nice simple but wonderful palate. Dry ending. T - a really nice Berliner. Tart lemon, subtle vinegar, wheat, egg funk and horse blanket. O - The best unfruited Berliner I've had. Very nice drinkable brew. Another fantastic SARA beer. 4.2

Appearance: Cloudy yellow color with little head
Aroma: Nice musty funky and hefe-like aroma 
Taste: Notes of grapefruit, lemon and apricot with a light tart texture
Overall: An easy drinking sour light flavorful band perfect for a hot summer day

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2014 Bottle: Thanks, Jeff! Translucent, goldenrod and yellow with a head thats gone in a few moments. Aroma is tart, cotton-y lemons and light musty funk. Some apple skins and a mild acidic character. Taste is quite tart... Almost like a "not as tart and watered down Beatification". Sour lemons, tart acidic sharpness, some stone fruit skins, mild wheat character and some dry woodsiness in the finish. Tart and sour aftertaste... Borderline puckering. Awesome stuff.

Bottle: The aroma consists of sour apple, lemon, and a touch of must. It pours a transparent white-gold with a minimal white head that almost instantly fades to nothing...event it looks still. The flavor starts with a quick dose of light apple. The finish has heavy sour lemon and a touch of must. Its light bodied with light carbonation.

In short: A Berliner weisse with a lacto-barnyard-funk character. Pretty good.
How: Bottle 750ml shared with people freezing in Vermont.
The look: Cloudy dark blonde body topped by a small white head.
In long: Nose is what youd expect from the style, a mix of lemony acidity along with mild funky character. Body doesnt feel watery at all despite the low abv and the soft carbonation helps in that regard. Taste has straws and wheat, a medium lactic acid presence, dirty funk (horseblanket), come citrus fruits, light yogurt notes. Very dry finish but not astringent. Certainly more lacto-funky and less lemony-tart than what Ive come to expect from the style, this comes through as some kind of semi-funky wheat based sour ale. I liked this beer a lot. And then a unicorn is riding a unicycle and a big toad are is playing the tuba and oh my god I can really write anything in these beer ratings.

Yum! One of my favorite styles in the summer. Light golden in color and clear. A whispy white head. Green apple and some wheat in the nose - just a twinge of sulfur, but it seems to go away quickly. Very tart, maybe overdoing it for the style, but I really like it. Lemon and green apple in the taste.
From bottle share at Ratebeer Gallery event. Pours cloudy with a short off-white head and a floral aroma. There is a sour light malt flavor with a dry finish.

Bottle purchased from tasting room during early spring 2013 release. Opened 6/15/2013. Pale, golden yellow pour. It definitely soured up since release. Tart and uber-refreshing. White grape skins and lemon citrus, with buttery lactic nuances and mild funk. Unmistakably sour aromas and flavors. Super mouthwatering. Low carbonation. Light bodied, with high acidity. Super easy to drink. Very, very white wine like. Another classic sour from this awesome brewery. I love their house microbes! 

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...

Thanks to burg326 for sharing this one at Berliner Bash.  Pours a hazy yellow with a receding white head.  Nose is some tart citrus, lemon, and a bit of bread with some lactic bite.  Flavor is similar with light citrus, bread, lactic, and lemon.  Light and refreshing for a Berliner.

Thanks for this, Dave! Pale golden pour with a nice haze. Lemon juice and zest aromas, lots of lactobacillus, yogurt, and tropical fruit. Dry malt profile, straw, and a slight funk. Really nice sourness to the flavor. Lemon, starfruit, and yogurt. Slight tropical notes, green apple skin, and wheat. Dry finish with some grass and straw notes. Very light and refreshing.

Bottle shared at Berliner Bash, poured a light cloudy golden with aromas of hay, barnyard and light tuna oil.  Interesting aroma, flavors were barnyard, and tart wheat, light and refreashing, a nice berliner.

750ml bottle shared among new friends at Harrys Hofrbau in San Jose. Pours a clear pale yellow into the glass with a small white head that slowly dissipates. Funky aromas of citrus, barnyard weirdness, straw, hay, wheat, apples and pear skins. First few sips are surprisingly sour with a funky acidic doughy, wet grain taste on the tongue. Not overwhelmingly sour, but definitely more so out of the bottle than I remember on tap. Body is light with very fizzy medium to high carbonation. Finish opens up to the bready berliner style that I recognize. Very interesting interpretation of the style, not very traditional. . I definitely enjoyed this on tap a little more..still a cool offering from Sante. Cheers

Bottle courtesy of Adam (burg), thanks sir. Pours a deep, hazy golden body with light white lacing. Aroma is rich, tart funk, lemon, lactobacillus, and light wheat. Mouthfeel is medium with nothing too tart up front, with notes of tart lemon, wheat, funky barnyard flavors and finish that is super lactic and jaw-wrenching. Very strange finish, I dont really get mouth-puckering, but it hits my jaw super hard. Very nice Berliner that stood up well to some of the others being poured during the Berliner Bash 2013.

Bottle at Stephens, thanks Steve! Hazy yellow pour with fizzy white head, aroma brought notes of biscuit, white fruits, nice lemon, bread, hints of corn but in a good way.  Taste is a mix of tart fruits, biscuit, bread, hints of vanilla, lots of lactic acid, finishing tart, dry.  A bit intense on the sour.

Bottle at home with friends. Pour is clear yellow with a a small white head that quickly dissipated. Wheaty, lightly tart, urine, a touch of lacto, vanilla, and funk in the aroma. Taste is tart, lemon peel, wheat, biscuit, straw, a touch of haresblanket, and hay with a light sour finish. Light body with low carbonation. Pretty cool beer.

Bottle @ Stephens house, courtesy of Steve_0. Thanks! Pours a hazy yellow appearance with a small white head. Quite tart, lacto forward, lemony, fairly funky aroma. Quite sour, tangy lemon, big lacto, vanilla, a touch buttery, barnyard, wheat flavor. Pretty interesting, refreshing brew.

750 bottle from brewery. Hazy straw yellow with a short lived fluffy white head. Earthy, musty, sulpherous horse blanket, fruit and damp grain aroma. Bright, slightly fuzzy light bodied palate. Tart citrus zest, apple, and earthy grain flavors up front with lemony and doughy wheat bread flavors on the back end and finishing dry and acidic. Earlier Rating: 1/26/2013 Total Score: 4.2On tap at brewery. Cloudy yellow with almost no head. Nice musty bready and sour green apple aroma with a hint of salt. Bright lively palate. Tastes of tart apple, sour berries, and salty bread with a dry earthy finish with nice oaky notes. Quite good.
Tap the brewery. Pours cloudy dark yellow, little head. Sour fruit aroma, taste is sour and fruit and clear. Refreshing.

On tap at the brewery. 
Nice tart aroma with a touch of citrus fruit and pineapple. Some mustiness present as while. Light wheat malt aroma. A very enjoyable aroma that has me going back for more. 
Pours a very hazy yellow gold, but this did come from the bottom of the keg. Little no head or retention. 
Flavor has a good deal of acidity throughout. Nice pineapple and citrus in the flavor as well. Light barnyard mustiness to compliment the acidity. No bitterness and no astringency. Tastes a bit salty; water must have high salinity. 
Mouthfeel is medium light bodied, but surprisingly full for such a small beer. Medium high carbonation, could possibly be a bit higher. 
Overall a super enjoyable beer. One of my favorite styles and a great version of it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at the brewery. Pours a medium gold with a fine white head. Really funky aroma, lactic and barnyardy, cheesy, lemon-lime tartness. Flavor is lemon-lime meringue, big lacto influence like those unflavored probiotic drinks, and the faintest maltiness, reminiscent of pie crust or snickerdoodles. Closer to the traditional German style than the extreme American interpretations.
